oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Soldiers
United States - History - Civil War, 1861-1865; Tennessee - History - Civil War, 1861-1865; Grainger County (Tenn.); Shiloh, Battle of, Tenn. 1862
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Gold-framed ambrotype of Confederate soldier Elijah Anderson (circa 1816-1862) in civilian clothes. Pinned to his left lapel is a ribbon displaying the name "Anderson."

Elijah Anderson was born circa 1816 in Grainger County, Tennessee. He lived in Cannon County, Tennessee, circa 1829-1858, before moving to Coffee County, Tennessee, circa 1859. He enlisted in the Confederate Army on either July 31, 1861, at Camp Anderson, or on August 24, 1861, at Camp Trousdale. A private in Company K of the 24th Tennessee Infantry Regiment, he reported sick to the hospital at Bowling Green, Kentucky, and later served at Shiloh, where he was wounded. He died of his wounds on April 17, 1862, in Corinth, Mississippi. Corinth was under Confederate control at the time of Elijah Anderson's death.
